title: Traceback shown when running `flask` without any args or an app
body:
### Expected Behavior

Only the error message / usage information being printed

### Actual Behavior

A traceback shows up above the usage information.

### Environment

* Python version: 2.7.14
* Flask version: 1.0.2
* Werkzeug version: 0.14.1


---


```

Collecting click>=5.1 (from flask)
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/34/c1/8806f99713ddb993c5366c362b2f908f18269f8d792aff1abfd700775a77/click-6.7-py2.py3-none-any.whl
```

comments_inline.body:
Didn't it originally only show the error message then someone made a PR adding the traceback? I'm wary of removing the traceback, since it could contain information about import or syntax errors.

Possible duplicate of #2741?
Yeah, duplicate of that issue. I think the traceback makes sense if a `FLASK_APP` is set/found, but not if there's simply nothing to import.
